title: Records request Anduril Arsenal-1 sewer and water lines/ Inkstick Media

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Records request Anduril Arsenal-1 sewer and water lines/ Inkstick Media
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Under the Ohio Open Records Law, §149.43 et seq., I hereby request the following records:

Copies of records submitted by the Verdantas civil engineering firm regarding utilities serving the Arsenal-1 Hyperscale Manufacturing Facility in Pickaway County. Specifically, I am seeking all applications and construction plans for an extension of a water line and sanitary/sewer systems to serve the Anduril plant, including a proposed timeline for construction.

At a Madison Township Trustees zoning hearing in December, Amanda Spencer, the director of land development at Verdantas, described the planned utilities, saying: “As far as utilities go, we are planning an extension of a water line that will run along the roadway. It is tied in to an existing water line that was constructed with previous phases of development. It will head north on Airbase road, and it will head east on Airbase road. Eventually, it will continue south on Walnut Creek Pike and end at the southeast corner of the development. The sanitary will tie into a long planned sanitary extension by the City of Columbus that will be constructed on the south side of Airbase road, right along the top of this development.”

I first submitted this request to the Pickaway County Engineer, whose office told me to direct records requests related to water lines serving the plant to the Earnhart Hill Regional Water & Sewer District.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

I would request a prompt response to this request.  If you expect a significant delay in responding to or in fulfilling this request, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies of the requested records.

Sincerely,

Taylor Barnes, Inkstick Media

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Records request Anduril Arsenal-1 sewer and water lines/ Inkstick Media
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon,

Below is a recent request from your organization we received on Sunday  January 18, 2026. Earnhart is supplying potable water to the subject project. The City of Columbus is taking the sanitary sewer (copied on this reply). To date, we have not received water line plans from Verdantas for their proposed public water line work along Airbase Rd. We have, however, attached a related public water line project that will eventually connect to the Verdantas project that you cite. These plans are in draft form and are not to be used for bidding or construction.


Earnhart Hill Regional Water & Sewer District

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Portage County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Portage County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

title: Officer Disciplinary Records - E Kuznetsov

communications.subject: Minnesota Government Data Practices Act Request: Officer Disciplinary Records - E Kuznetsov
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act, I hereby request the following records:

During an incident on 2/9 involving an ICE vehicle, a Minnetonka Police Officer is seen on video shoving a women while her back is turned. The officer appears to be wearing badge 193, with a nameplate listing "E Kuznetsov". We are seeking information about this officer's training and disciplinary records, including:
1) Complaints filed against the officer from their start date through the date you fulfill this request. Please include substantiated/investigated complaints as well as any there may have been deemed unsubstantiated. We do NOT want any identifying information of the individuals who made the complaints. 
2) All personnel file records referring to disciplinary actions, reprimands, corrective actions, performance evaluations reflecting misconduct, and sustained force findings for Officer E. Kuznetsov.
3) Complete training history for Officer E. Kuznetsov, including course titles, agencies providing training, completion certificates/grades, and dates, specifically: Use-of-Force/De-Escalation training, Crowd Control / Mass Demonstration training, Less-Lethal Weapon / Tactics training, Any annual in-service or refresher training related to force or public order.

Please reach out with any questions, I'm happy to provide clarification if needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Alan J. Segal

Mr. Segal,

Please see the responses to your request below. If you need additional assistance, please reach out to me via email, jtait@minnetonkamn.gov

1) Complaints filed against the officer from their start date through the date you fulfill this request. Please include substantiated/investigated complaints as well as any there may have been deemed unsubstantiated. We do NOT want any identifying information of the individuals who made the complaints.

We did receive two citizen complaints related to the incident you are describing. These complaints are still in the review process and there is no disposition as of now. Officer Kuznetsov has no other complaints in his file.

2) All personnel file records referring to disciplinary actions, reprimands, corrective actions, performance evaluations reflecting misconduct, and sustained force findings for Officer E. Kuznetsov.

Officer Kuznetsov has no discipline in his file or other materials you have called out. 

3) Complete training history for Officer E. Kuznetsov, including course titles, agencies providing training, completion certificates/grades, and dates, specifically: Use-of-Force/De-Escalation training, Crowd Control / Mass Demonstration training, Less-Lethal Weapon / Tactics training, Any annual in-service or refresher training related to force or public order.

Officer Kuznetsov's training records are attached. If you feel this is not sufficient or if you have questions, please let me know. 

Jason Tait

title: Request for Dept. of Correction Commissioners / Wardens Contact Information

communications.subject: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: Request for Dept. of Correction Commissioners / Wardens Contact Information
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maine Freedom of Access Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A list of prison wardens and assistant wardens currently employed by the Maine Department of Corrections, including for each record:

- Full names
- Job titles
- Assigned correctional facility
- Government-issued email addresses
- Government-issued phone numbers (direct desk numbers if available, otherwise department phone numbers with or without extensions)
- Department/division

2. A list of state-level commissioners/directors and deputy commissioners/directors currently employed by the Maine Department of Corrections, including for each record:

- Full name
- Official job title
- Division / bureau
- Official work email address
- Official office phone number
- Official work mailing address

If available, I request this information be provided in a machine-readable format such as CSV or Excel.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by 1 M.R.S.A. § 408(6). The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Morgan P Hatch Jr

communications.subject: **FOAA Request** 2025118 Morgan P Hatch Jr 22 Dec 25
communications.communication:
The Maine Department of Corrections has received your request for information under the Maine Freedom of Access Act (FOAA).  Your request will be evaluated to determine if it comes within the FOAA, if it is clear as to what information you are requesting, and if nonconfidential records already exist that would fulfill all or part of your request.  If your request does not come within the FOAA, is not clear, or no records exist, you will be so notified.  If records exist, but they are confidential, you will be notified of the basis for that determination.  If nonconfidential records exist, you will be provided a good faith, nonbinding estimate of the time within which you will be provided the records, as well as an estimate of the costs that are allowed by the FOAA, if applicable.

V/r

Jenna Heald
Maine Department of Corrections
Policy & PowerDMS Assistant
FOAA Coordinator

title: Security Assistance for Ukraine since January 2025

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Security Assistance for Ukraine since January 2025
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

An itemized list of which elements of the Additional Security Assistance for Ukraine, announced January 9, 2025, were subsequently delivered to Ukraine, and in addition, which elements of previously-announced Ukraine Security Assistance under Presidential Drawdown Authority were subsequently delivered to Ukraine, since January 20, 2025. Please include the date on which each element was delivered.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael Tracey

communications.communication:
Good morning Mr. Tracey,

 

This email serves to confirm receipt of your two letters sent to our OSW/JS
FOIA office, requesting a status update on your FOIA case 25-F-4109. I have
reached out to the component conducting the search for responsive records
for an Estimated Date of Completion (ECD). Once I receive this ECD from the
component, I will relay it to you.

 

We apologize for the delay in the processing of your request, as our office
was affected by the recent government shutdown. Thank you for your patience.

 

 

V/r, 

 

Meghann Burgess

FOIA Analyst

Freedom of Information Division OSW/JS

communications.subject: OSW/JS FOIA 25-F-4109 Status Update
communications.communication:
Good afternoon Mr. Tracey,

 

I have reached out to the component office of the Office of the Secretary of
War (OSW) who is currently conducting the search/review of responsive
records. The estimated completion date provided to our office is 3 months
from now, February 11, 2026. Please know that this is an estimate and is
subject to change.  It may be completed before this time, but there is also
a possibility that additional time may be needed to complete this request.

 

Our FOIA office is actively working your request, and I apologize for the
delay in processing time. Please reach out with further questions or

title: Records Related to DOJ Voter Data Requests (Department of Elections)

communications.subject: Delaware Freedom of Information Act Request: Records Related to DOJ Voter Data Requests (Department of Elections)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Delaware Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

From January 20, 2025 to the present:

1. Any memoranda of understanding, agreements, or contracts — executed, draft, proposed, or rejected — between this agency and the U.S. Department of Justice relating to voter registration data, voter files, or voter list maintenance.

2. All correspondence between this agency and the DOJ (including the Civil Rights Division, AG's office, and EOIR) relating to voter registration data, voter files, or voter list maintenance.

3. All internal communications — including emails, memos, meeting notes, and briefing materials — discussing or responsive to any DOJ request for voter data or any proposed or executed MOU with the DOJ regarding voter data.

4. Any lists or records received from the DOJ identifying voters for removal or review.

5. All records relating to any third-party contractor engaged in connection with DOJ voter data requests or list maintenance activities pursuant to any DOJ agreement.

Please identify the specific statutory exemption for any records withheld.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jonathan Rudenberg, a citizen of Delaware, in coordination with Audrey Nielsen.

communications.subject: RE: Delaware Freedom of Information Act Request: Records Related to DOJ Voter Data Requests (Department of Elections) FOIA Request JR021926
communications.communication:
Dear Jonathan Rudenberg -

The Department of Elections received your FOIA request for “any and all” communications between the United States Department of Justice and the Delaware Department of Elections “over the last three months”.

The Delaware Department of Elections has published the correspondence to its website under “Public Notices,” https://elections.delaware.gov/public/notices.shtml, and they are available at the following direct links:

  *   Delaware Department of Elections Communications with the U.S. Department of Justice
     *   US DOJ Letter to DE DOE, July 11, 2025<https://elections.delaware.gov/voter/pdfs/USDOJ_Letter_20250711.pdf>
     *   DE DOE Response Letter to US DOJ, July 25, 2025<https://elections.delaware.gov/voter/pdfs/DE_DOE-US_DOJ_Response_Letter_20250725.pdf>
     *   US DOJ Letter to DE DOE, August 4, 2025<https://elections.delaware.gov/voter/pdfs/USDOJ_Letter_20250804.pdf>
     *   DE DOJ Email to US DOJ, August 6, 2025<https://elections.delaware.gov/voter/pdfs/DE_DOJ_Email_to_US_DOJ_August_6_2025.pdf>
     *   US DOJ Letter to DE DOE, August 14, 2025<https://elections.delaware.gov/voter/pdfs/USDOJ_Letter_20250814.pdf>
     *   DE DOE Response Letter to US DOJ, August 15, 2025<https://elections.delaware.gov/voter/pdfs/DE_DOE-US_DOJ_Response_Letter_20250815.pdf>
     *   DE DOE Response Letter to US DOJ, August 21, 2025<https://elections.delaware.gov/voter/pdfs/DE_DOE-US_DOJ_Response_Letter_20250821.pdf>
     *   DE DOE Response Letter to US DOJ, September 16, 2025<https://elections.delaware.gov/voter/pdfs/DE_DOE-US_DOJ_Response_Letter_09162025.pdf>

These letters constitute the records responsive to your FOIA request.

In response to your request for “all internal communications,” please be advised that access to these records have been denied pursuant to investigatory privilege under 29 Del. C. § 10002(o)(3) or because specifically exempted from public disclosure by statute or common law (for example because subject to attorney-client privilege or work product protection) under 29 Del. C. § 10002(o)(6).

Thank you very much.

Best,
Cathleen Hartsky-Carter
Community Relations Officer/FOIA Coordinator
State of Delaware Department of Elections
905 S Governors Ave, Suite 170
Dover, DE 19904
302-484-0392
302-739-4277
https://elections.delaware.gov<https://elections.delaware.gov/>
https://ivote.de.gov<https://ivote.de.gov/>

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: PG Co. Verra (Prince George's County Public Schools)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Can you please provide the number of total buses serving students with special needs, number of total buses serving students with special needs equipped with Verra Mobility stop arm cameras, number of total school buses and number total buses equipped with Verra Mobility (also known as American Traffic Solutions) stop arm cameras from the last year the program was operating? 

As well as the contract with the vendor, plus the termination agreement, if that has happened.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jon Smith

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Kanawha County Sheriff)

communications.subject: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Kanawha County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the West Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

title: West Virginia HHS response updated

communications.subject: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: West Virginia HHS response updated
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the West Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Communications and correspondence with the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services regarding the Aug. 26, 2025, HHS letter requesting the West Virginia Department of Health remove content from the state's Personal Responsibility Education Program curricula and program materials. For reference, the letter can be found here: https://acf.gov/sites/default/files/documents/main/08.26.25-Combined-PREP-Letters.pdf.

I also request internal communications between any West Virginia Department of Health employees about the aforementioned letter. If the content changes were made, I request a copy of the material before it was changed as well as a copy of the material after it was changed.

I additionally request that, if possible, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

title: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the department’s Flock Safety system:
1. Organization Audit in Flock. 
The report should include data logged from the period of June 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of June 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable. Please do not redirect me to your transparency portal.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All quotes and invoices for automated license plate readers (including Flock Safety, Vigilant/Motorola Solutions) sent to the Imperial Valley Law Enforcement Coordination Center/Imperial Valley HIDTA from Jan 1. 2022 through Jan. 30, 2026.

For your assistance in locating records, these have previously been sent to elsa.guzman@ivlecc.hidta.org and chuck.cloud@ivlecc.hidta.org, however other emails may be relevant. Sincerely,

Dave Maass

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: HIDTA LPR - Imperial Valley (Brawley Police Department)
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

The PRA request will be forwarded to city attorney, representing the City of Brawley, for review. We will respond once all information has been researched and compiled.

The email from February 10, 2026 (below), included a request from January 30, 2026, but it does not specify to whom the request was initially sent. Included in that message is a link to the City of Calexico City Council Agenda Staff Report. Please advise on the relevance of this to the City of Brawley Police Department PRA request. This will assist us in understanding what is being requested and provide the correct information.

Thank you.


Respectfully,

[Text  AI-generated content may be incorrect.]

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: HIDTA LPR - Imperial Valley (Brawley Police Department)
communications.communication:
For reference, this is the link: https://www.calexico.ca.gov/vertical/sites/%7B342ED706-1EBB-4FDE-BD1E-9543BAD44C09%7D/uploads/City_Council_Agenda_12-21-2022_Item_No._10.pdf

On page 6 of the document, enumerated item 9, it talks about $25,000 for Brawley PD to purchase 4 flock cameras for 2 years service. 

At the bottom of page 6, and continued on to page 7, it directs agencies who receive money for these items to submit quotes and invoices to IVLECC.

Dave Maass
Director of Investigations
Electronic Frontier Foundation

communications.subject: Police Records Request :: P000039-011426
communications.communication:
Dear Gerardo Leon: 
Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 1/14/2026 and given the reference number P000039-011426 for tracking purposes. 
 Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Records related to the department’s Flock Safety system: 
1. Organization Audit in Flock. 
The report should include data logged from the period of March 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency. 

2. Network Audit in Flock. 
The report should include data logged from the period of March 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System. 

3. A list of network share settings that include: 
3a. Flock networks shared with me 
3b. Networks that I’m sharing 

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable. Please do not redirect me to your transparency portal. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Gerardo Leon 

Upload documents directly: https://www.muckrock.com/respond/2179451/ 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. 
 
City of Campbell

communications.subject: Police Records Request :: P000039-011426
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
RE: Police Records Request of January 14, 2026, Reference # P000039-011426 Dear Gerardo Leon, This email is in response to your email dated 01/14/2026, which was received by the City on the same day. Except as expressly noted below, it is the City’s intent to cooperate with you in identifying any records that would be responsive to your request, and to expeditiously provide you with those records. However, as you may be aware, under California Law, a request for documents must reasonably describe an identifiable record, and must be focused and specific. (See Cal. Govt. Code § 7922.530(a); Rogers v. Superior Court , 19 Cal.App.4th 469, 481.) Likewise, cities are not required to create a new record in response to a request. (See Haynie v. Superior Court , 26 Cal.4th 1061, 1075.) Nevertheless, the City will use its best efforts to identify all records that may be responsive to your requests. As you may have anticipated , we will be withholding and/or redacting any writings that consists of records of investigations conducted by the Police Department that are exempt from disclosure pursuant to California Government Code Section 7923.600(a). In response to your request for item 3a- you can obtain this information by visiting our transparency portal at https://transparency.flocksafety.com/campbell-ca-pd Due to the need to search and collect a large volume of records for item #1 and Item #2 and Item #3b, I will require an additional 14 days to respond to your request. I anticipate providing a response by Monday, February 9, 2026. 
For questions or additional information, please reply to this email. Sincerely, Mihui Cho 
Records -PD

communications.subject: Police Records Request :: P000039-011426
communications.communication:

We are experiencing challenges in providing the information requested for item #2 due to the volume of records generated each month and the file‑size limitations that prevent us from opening them. For context, each month’s record contains more than 90,000 results. At this time, we do not have a method to produce these records. Accordingly, with the records released for item #1, we have provided all responsive documents pertaining to your request, and the matter is considered closed. For questions or additional information, please reply to this email. Sincerely, Mihui Cho 
Police Department

title: Banned books list (Department of Corrections)

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Banned books list (Department of Corrections)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all books and other printed publications that are banned or otherwise not permitted in prisons. Please include the title and author of the publication. If available, please include the reasons for prohibiting the publication, as well as the date of the decision.

If possible, please send this information in a searchable spreadsheet format, such as an Excel file or a CSV file.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

RE: FOI Records Request of January 30, 2026, Reference # R000293-013026. 
Dear Dillon Bergin, 
The Department of Correction received a public information request from you on January 30, 2026. Your request mentioned: “To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records: 

A list of all books and other printed publications that are banned or otherwise not permitted in prisons. Please include the title and author of the publication. If available, please include the reasons for prohibiting the publication, as well as the date of the decision. 

If possible, please send this information in a searchable spreadsheet format, such as an Excel file or a CSV file. 

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Dillon Bergin 

Upload documents directly: https://www.muckrock.com/respond/2204434/” 
The Department of Correction has reviewed its files and has located responsive records to your request. Please log in to the FOI Records Request Center at the following link to retrieve the appropriate responsive documents. FOI Records Request - R000293-013026 
If you have any questions, or wish to discuss this further, please contact me. 
Sincerely, 
Stephanie Secore 
FOI Administrator 
Central Office FOI Unit

title: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the department’s Flock Safety system:
1. Organization Audit in Flock. 
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable. Please do not redirect me to your transparency portal.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris TenHarmsel

communications.subject: PD-2026-5
communications.communication:
Dear Chris TenHarmsel: 
  
 RE: Record Request Request Number: PD-2026-5 
  
 This letter will respond to your Freedom of Information Act request deemed received by the Freedom of Information Act Coordinator on 01/02/2026. Below is a description of the request you made: 
  
 Name(s) of involved person(s): 
  
 Name of client (if applicable):

Report number:

Description of public record(s): I hereby request the following records: Records related to the department’s Flock Safety system: 1. Organization Audit in Flock. The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency. 2. Network Audit in Flock. The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System. 3. A list of network share settings that include: 3a. Flock networks shared with me 3b. Networks that I’m sharing Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable.

In a preliminary search of departmental records, we located twelve (12) organizational audits, and one (1) shared network list. No network audits were located. 
  
 Your request is GRANTED in part and DENIED in part as to any exemptions that may apply. There will be a significant amount of employee time that must be expended, in order to search for and compile documents that comply with your request as well as reviewing the documents for relevancy and redaction of the records. MCL 15.234(8) permits a public body to “require at the time a request is made a good-faith deposit from the person requesting information . . . if the entire fee estimate or charge authorized [by the statute] exceeds $50.00, based on a good-faith calculation of the total fee…. [T]he deposit shall not exceed ½ of the total estimated fee….” 
  
 To view and pay your invoice, please click the following link: Request Number: PD-2026-5. The invoice is also attached to this response. The amount listed on this invoice has been adjusted to reflect a 50% deposit of the total estimated costs. The current amount due is $1963.80. You will be responsible for any remaining balance once the fulfillment process is completed. 
  
 Please be advised that pursuant to MCL 15.234(14) we will consider the request abandoned and will no longer be required to fulfil your request if the deposit is not received within forty-eight (48) days after this correspondence has been sent by our office or you have not filed an appeal of the deposit amount pursuant to section 10a. Once this office receives your deposit, your request will be placed into a queue to be fulfilled. Due to the amount of FOIA requests we’re currently processing, it is estimated that once deposit payment is received, it will take six to eight (6-8) months until you receive the final invoice and/or records. You will be responsible for any remaining balance once the fulfillment process is completed. 
  
 If you wish to amend your request to change the records you wish to receive, you will need to do so by filing a new FOIA at the following link: https://url4102.request.justfoia.com/ls/click?upn=u001.nrfdmL-2B1UhWpB4V2ArB2sdB-2B6kzx5xZDTE6YDr2ENJxH6yxceD516ltasGiG-2B4brN82O7vDwiPKY5eZhlH7ky6ibfwkf1Ko5LxJk3jNnBjacxt2MIE5NGd1VR9NBvelBRwS__1WF8FJOw6CM0UVLRF29uH0xoLqKtZA39HRyfmuAV9Rz6lU9goPlwIeWajfpm3b2JsswvcaF5LTKBXEt1SarMhP1tsFvQowR4hLvpe0tsNHkAQb0xtibM4Z-2FOdAoBy5YsPgQ-2BeWUCRFTxWJIklYomkEkqyOxlpJhDtVB74X6RZnslo9nhX50Pl-2FIrCzv3GFLbRnGvOZfWIUNPSHiF8Q5qzd8MwJsn1cQ8kUEryVPZgkrXeiWyWokmKYpIxfZdPbd3iRfMDnsOq7qmfX-2BrYMTxfaUQp-2Fr48CiaxV5-2FP3jNugR4hoPbsFkiBGOOuBRlpWhc 
  
 A copy of the City of Grand Rapids FOIA policy, including your right to appeal, is enclosed. communications.subject: RE: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request #PD-2026-5
communications.communication:
Hello,
Thank you for getting back to our request.  In light of the level of effort associated with the original request, could we modify the data being requested?  I believe the following configuration settings would provide us with the information we care about most while also not requiring intense work to provide as they are screenshots or CSV representations of configuration settings only and thus should contain no privileged data.

CSV generated from Sharing -> Network Sharing -> Shared Networks -> Download CSV
Configuration value of Organization -> Search Features -> Enable Statewide Lookup
Configuration value of Organization -> Search Features -> Enable National Lookup
Networks -> Network Sharing -> My Networks -> Download CSV
For each network in Networks -> Network Sharing -> My Networks:
- A screenshot of the network settings, OR
- Is "Automatically Accepts Request to share my network with LE agencies within" enabled? What is the radius if enabled?
- Name and Value of each toggle control within "Make this network Discoverable" section
- Is "Automatically Accepts Request to share my network with LE agencies within my state" enabled?
- Name and Value of each toggle control within "Allow these features to be automatically shared"
- Description of other available configuration options on the network sharing configuration page along with values

Thanks,
Chris

Thank you.

title: CO County CVR Request (2022, 2024) (Garfield County Clerk and Recorder's Office)

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: CO County CVR Request (2022, 2024) (Garfield County Clerk and Recorder's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Cast vote record (CVR) data for the following elections:
1. 2022 Nov Midterm Election
2. 2024 Nov General Election

Specifically, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast each election generated by the voting system.

In case it is helpful for your reference, you can find an example of these records in REDACTED format at this link on the Arapahoe County webpage: https://www.arapahoevotes.gov/transparency
If you follow the "Redacted Cast Vote Record (CVR)" link on that webpage, it will download a csv file with Arapahoe County's redacted CVR records (this: https://gis.arapahoegov.com/dl_data/cr_voter_data/redacted_cvr/REDACTED_CVR_Export_20241126111830_330948.zip.)

I am requesting these records NOT redacted pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act. Please let me know if you need any further clarification on the type of data that I am requesting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska

To whom it may concern,
Your request cannot be completed as filed. Please use the CORA request form located on our website.

https://www.garfieldcountyco.gov/attorney/open-records-policy/

Thank you,
Garfield County Elections

title: utah books (Davis School District)

communications.subject: Government Records Access and Management Act Request: utah books (Davis School District)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Government Records Access and Management Act, I hereby request the following records:

Public reports show that this school district has been subject to book and curriculum challenges:

https://www.sltrib.com/news/education/2026/01/05/utah-bans-three-more-books-public/

Therefore, I request the following:

1) All instructional materials, presentations and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, PowerPoint files, prepared remarks, and slides formats), and other guidance related to "rated books", "destiny", "objective sensitive material”, or "utah parents united". This includes A) any notes taken during meetings that book and curriculum challenges B) any other document that has been used to help explain book and curriculum challenges, including internal documentation, public relations materials, and executive summaries.

2) Any digital communications (including but not limited to emails and text messages) as well as documents, (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents) about, pertaining to, or mentioning "rated books", “destiny”, “objective sensitive material”, “wicked”, “nineteen minutes”, “beloved”, “the perks of being a wallflower”,"destiny", "sacrilegious", "deviant content", or "utah parents united".

3) Any emails, presentations, videos, memos, recordings, or other records mentioning "rated books", "destiny", "objective sensitive material”, or "utah parents united"

Please perform this search for records between August 1, 2025 and the time this request is processed. This request is not for commercial purposes and will be used in the course of reporting for 404 Media, an independent, journalist-owned news site (www.404media.co).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Claire Woodcock

title: Financial Report Request (James Madison University)

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Financial Report Request (James Madison University)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) I would like a copy of the annual NCAA MFRS report for FY2017 - FY2025. These annual reports are submitted by the athletic department and record the revenue/expenses of the department. It is an approximately 90 page document listing revenue and expenses in the athletic department by team. It is a standard annual NCAA form. The latest FY2025 report was due, 1/15/2025 so should be available. If you are unable to include this, can you please specify if you will send it to me immediately when it's available or if you want me to make a new request. That should be 9 reports combined.

2) I'd like copies of the latest contracts for your athletic director and head coaches of football, mens/womens basketball, and mens/womens ice hockey if you have those teams. That should be 6 documents if you have that many teams.

Please let me know if you have any questions. Thank you for your time.

Best,

Greg Chick

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Greg Chick.

title: Connecticut HHS response

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Connecticut HHS response
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Communications and correspondence with the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services regarding the Aug. 26, 2025, HHS letter requesting the Connecticut Department of Public Health remove content from the state's Personal Responsibility Education Program curricula and program materials. For reference, the letter can be found here: https://acf.gov/sites/default/files/documents/main/08.26.25-Combined-PREP-Letters.pdf.

I also request internal communications between any Connecticut Department of Public Health employees about the aforementioned letter. If the content changes were made, I request a copy of the material before it was changed as well as a copy of the material after it was changed.

I additionally request that,  if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

title: 2025 list of Nassau Republican Committee Elected Members

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: 2025 list of Nassau Republican Committee Elected Members
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request access to and copies of the following records pertaining to the Nassau County Republican Committee.   Specifically for Calendar Year 2025  (January 1st 2025 - December 31st 2025):

1. A current list of all elected County Committee Members ​and/or Associate Committee Members of the Nassau County Republican Committee, including for each member: name, the election district and assembly district they represent, and the date of their election or appointment.
2. A current list of all elected Assembly District Leaders and/or Associate Assembly District Leaders of the Nassau County Republican Committee, including for each: name, the assembly district or portion thereof they represent, and the date of their election or appointment.
3. A current list of all elected Judicial Delegates and Alternate Judicial Delegates affiliated with the Nassau County Republican Committee, including for each: name, the judicial district they represent, and the date of their election or appointment.
4. Results of the most recent primary election(s) in which the above party positions were on the ballot in Nassau County, including vote totals for contested and uncontested races.
5. Any designating petitions filed for the above party positions in the most recent applicable election cycle.

If any of the above records are maintained in electronic format, I would prefer to receive them electronically (via email) to minimize copying costs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael Northrup

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Muskingum County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Muskingum County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

title: Brooklyn Park Police complaints

communications.subject: Minnesota Government Data Practices Act Request: Brooklyn Park Police complaints
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act, I hereby request the following records:

- All citizen and officer complaints filed between Jan. 1, 2026 and Jan. 20, 2026.
- Any complaints, requests for service, or incident reports involving federal law enforcement officers between Jan. 1, 2026 and Jan. 20, 2026.

For assistance in locating these records, Police Chief Mark Bruley said in a public press conference that: "We're hearing people being stopped with no cause & being demanded to show paperwork to determine if they're here legally. We started hearing from our police officers the same complaints." (https://bsky.app/profile/atrupar.com/post/3mcuopvhabn2r)

I am requesting any written or telephonic complaints from citizens or officers, as well as any other reports or memoranda generated by such incidents.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

CJ Ciaramella

title: Formal Public Records Request: Data on Top Employers of SNAP Recipients

communications.subject: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request: Formal Public Records Request: Data on Top Employers of SNAP Recipients
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Indiana Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on the employers in the state of Indiana with more than one hundred workers receiving benefits from the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP), commonly referred to as food assistance.

Specifically, I request the following information, if available:

1. The name of the employer.
2. The total number of the employer's workers who are currently receiving SNAP benefits.
3. The time period this data covers (e.g., the most recent quarter or year for which data is available).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David Moore

title: Log#1048311 RD#HT470555 - Requesting all documents surrounding Log#1048311 including all OEMC audio transmissions (Civilian Office Of Police Accountability)

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Log#1048311 RD#HT470555 - Requesting all documents surrounding Log#1048311 including all OEMC audio transmissions (Civilian Office Of Police Accountability)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Requesting all documents and OEMC audio transmissions surrounding CR Log#1048311, initiated August 29, 2011 and closed September 8, 2014, Use of Force- Excessive,  Complaint Log #1048311, that lead to Federal lawsuit, case # 12-cv-08690.  CR Log# 1048311, accused officers; Jacqueline Watkins, Brian Burton, and Ray Clausell.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jacqueline A. Watkins

title: Weymouth Wednesdays

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Weymouth Wednesdays
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Subject: FOIA Request for Information Regarding Traffic Enforcement Policies

 I am writing to request information under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) related to the traffic enforcement policies of Weymouth Police Department.  Specifically, I seek documentation regarding the recent directive that instructs officers and command staff to conduct traffic enforcement exclusively on Wednesdays.

To assist in the processing of this request, please provide:

1. Any memos, emails, or internal communications from agency leadership discussing or promoting the strategy to issue tickets solely on Wednesdays.

2. Statistical data or reports that outline traffic enforcement activities, including the number of tickets issued on Wednesdays compared to other days of the week.

3. Any relevant guidelines or policies that mandate or suggest certain days for traffic enforcement over others.

4. Information on the objectives behind this strategy and whether any analysis was conducted before its implementation.

I propose a fee waiver for this request based on the public interest in transparency around law enforcement practices. This information is crucial for understanding how these policies may impact public safety and the fair application of traffic laws.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

TransparentPolicing2026

communications.subject: RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request #26-385
communications.communication:
Subject: Follow-up FOIA Request for Information Regarding Traffic Enforcement Policies and Operational Readiness Deployments (ORD)

This letter constitutes a follow-up request pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, building upon my previous request, #26-385, to which I received a response from Captain Perchard on 01/28/2026.  I acknowledge receipt and review of the provided emails and attached documents, including the Operational Readiness Program 2025 Annual Review and various monthly ORD memos.

While Captain Perchard's response indicated that the Weymouth Police Department does not maintain compiled data regarding citation issuance by day of the week and also that there is no requirement to issue citations during Operational Readiness Deployments (ORD), the provided materials did include statistics related to increased traffic stops during these deployments.  My analysis of these documents has raised further questions regarding the program's impact, objectives, and associated metrics.

Specifically, I am requesting the following additional records and information:


1.  **Funding and Budgetary Impact of Calls for Service Data:**
    
*   All documents, reports, or communications that describe how the Weymouth Police Department utilizes "calls for service" data, including yearly call volume projections, for budgetary requests, staffing justifications, or seeking increased funding.
 *   Any presentations, meeting minutes, or memoranda prepared for or presented to finance committees or other municipal bodies, where calls for service data was used to support requests for budget items or additional police officers.


2. **Policies and Information Regarding Performance Metrics and Justification for Non-Patrol Personnel Roles (When Not on ORD):**
    *   Please provide all policies, guidelines, or internal communications that describe the performance metrics used to evaluate the regular duties and contributions of non-patrol personnel (e.g., members of command staff, supervisors, detectives, and officers regularly assigned to administrative functions) when they are *not* deployed on Operational Readiness.
    *   We also request any documentation or analysis that justifies the *established need* for these non-patrol personnel in their standard roles, including how their specific functions contribute to department objectives and overall public safety outside of ORD deployments."


3.  **Detailed Activity Breakdown for a Specific Week:**
 
*   Despite the previous statement that compiled data on daily citation issuance is not maintained which I find not credible I request records that would allow for a breakdown of enforcement activities.  Specifically at this time only for the week of **December 14th, 2025 to December 20th, 2025**, please provide:
*   The total number of citations issued.
*   The total number of warrants serviced.
*   The total number of field interviews conducted.
*   *Please provide this breakdown for each day within the specified week:*
            *   Sunday, December 14th, 2025
            *   Monday, December 15th, 2025
            *   Tuesday, December 16th, 2025
            *   Wednesday, December 17th, 2025
            *   Thursday, December 18th, 2025
            *   Friday, December 19th, 2025
            *   Saturday, December 20th, 2025
 *   I understand that the department may not explicitly track "citations issued by day of the week" as a pre-compiled report. However, I believe individual records of these actions exist and can be compiled for this specific period to provide the requested data which is essential for understanding enforcement patterns.

4.  **Additional Metrics and Data Related to ORD Deployments:**
    *   Any reports/analyses, or data comparing "use of force" incidents that occur during ORD deployment days versus non-ORD deployment days.
    *   Any records/analysis containing racial profiling data, including demographic information of individuals who are subjected to initiated stops, citations, or use of force during ORD deployments.

I propose a fee waiver for this request based on the public interest in transparency around law enforcement practices.  This information is crucial for understanding how these policies may impact public safety and the fair application of law.  The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and are not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

title: DOJ Voter Data Request Communications (Secretary of State)

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: DOJ Voter Data Request Communications (Secretary of State)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

From January 20, 2025 to the present:

1. All correspondence, emails, letters, and written communications between the agency and the U.S. Department of Justice, including but not limited to the Civil Rights Division, the Office of the Attorney General, and the Executive Office for Immigration Review, relating to voter registration data, voter files, voter rolls, or voter list maintenance.

2. All internal communications within the agency (including emails, memoranda, and briefing materials) discussing, referencing, or responsive to any DOJ request for voter registration data or any proposed or executed memorandum of understanding with the DOJ regarding voter data.

3. Any lists, spreadsheets, databases, or other records received from the DOJ identifying specific voters for removal, investigation, or further review.

4. All records relating to the engagement of any third-party contractor in connection with DOJ voter data requests or voter list maintenance activities conducted pursuant to any agreement with the DOJ.

If any records are withheld in whole or in part, please identify the specific statutory exemption relied upon for each withholding.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Audrey Nielsen

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Marin County Sheriff)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Marin County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

title: California official reports RFP, agreements, correspondence (California Secretary of State)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: California official reports RFP, agreements, correspondence (California Secretary of State)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The below requests are all in connection with the California Supreme Court's Request for Proposal RFP-CAL-2023-01-RP for publication of the California official reports (the "RFP"), made under Government Code section 68903, and which is available at https://courts.ca.gov/request/rfp-cal-2023-01-rp/rfp/publication-california-official-reports.

Government Code section 68903 states:

"The official reports shall be published under a contract to be entered into on behalf of the state by the Chief Justice of California, the Secretary of State, the Attorney General, the President of the State Bar, and the Reporter of Decisions, who shall serve as secretary."

REQUESTS:

1. All signed agreements made under proposals received pursuant to the RFP, including subsequent signed amendments (collectively, the "Agreements").
2. All correspondence with LexisNexis about the RFP.
3. All correspondence with LexisNexis about the Agreements.
4. All proposals received in response to the RFP.
5. All internal correspondence related to the RFP.

If assessing any confidentiality concerns, please note the following language in the RFP:

11.0 CONFIDENTIAL OR PROPRIETARY INFORMATION
PROPOSALS ARE SUBJECT TO DISCLOSURE TO THIRD PARTIES AND MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC PURSUANT TO APPLICABLE LAWS, INCLUDING PUBLIC DISCLOSURE PURSUANT TO RULE 10.500 OF THE CALIFORNIA RULES OF COURT. Except as required by law, neither the Judicial Council nor the Court will disclose (i) social security numbers, or (ii) balance sheets or income statements submitted by a Publisher that is not a publicly traded corporation. All other information in Proposals may be disclosed in response to applicable public records requests, or as otherwise required by law. Such disclosure may be made regardless of whether the Proposal (or portions thereof) is marked “confidential,” “proprietary,” “copyright ©,” or otherwise, and regardless of any statement in the Proposal (a) purporting to limit the Judicial Council’s or Court’s right to disclose information in the Proposal, or (b) requiring the Judicial Council or Court to inform or obtain the consent of the Publisher prior to the disclosure of the Proposal (or portions thereof). Any Proposal that is password protected, or contains portions that are password protected, may be rejected. Submission of any Proposal pursuant to this RFP constitutes acknowledgment and consent by the Publisher to the potential public disclosure of its Proposal content, as set forth in this section. Publishers are accordingly cautioned not to include confidential, proprietary, or privileged information in proposals.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available, or by USB drive, CD-ROM, or online file sharing system if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ansel Halliburton

title: Financial Report Request (University of Tennessee, Knoxville)

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Financial Report Request (University of Tennessee, Knoxville)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) I would like a copy of the annual NCAA MFRS report for FY2017 - FY2025. These annual reports are submitted by the athletic department and record the revenue/expenses of the department. It is an approximately 90 page document listing revenue and expenses in the athletic department by team. It is a standard annual NCAA form. The latest FY2025 report was due, 1/15/2025 so should be available. If you are unable to include this, can you please specify if you will send it to me immediately when it's available or if you want me to make a new request. That should be 9 reports combined.

2) I'd like copies of the latest contracts for your athletic director and head coaches of football, mens/womens basketball, and mens/womens ice hockey if you have those teams. That should be 6 documents if you have that many teams.

Please let me know if you have any questions. Thank you for your time.

Best,

Greg Chick

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Greg Chick.
