title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Somerset County Sheriff)

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Somerset County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

title: Killing / assassination of Cambodian-American Haing Ngor in Los Angeles 02-25-1996 (Los Angeles Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Killing / assassination of Cambodian-American Haing Ngor in Los Angeles 02-25-1996 (Los Angeles Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I hereby request any and all documents related to the murder of Dr. Haing Samnang Ngor, an American citizen who was murdered in Los Angeles on February 25, 1996.  A former refugee, Ngor was originally from Cambodia.

Ngor was an actor, who won an Academy Award for his role in the 1984 film, "The Killing Fields," about Cambodia's communist extremists, known as the Khmer Rouge. As such, there were concerns that group may have assassinated him on US soil.

At the time of his death, Ngor was  considering running for high office in Cambodia, and I request information related to his political ambitions (for the Khmer Nation Party) be included in your disclosure.

Ngor was due to attend a fundraising luncheon, in April 1996,  with President Bill Clinton and  Vice President Al Gore.  Please include relevant documents related to this element of the investigation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mary Patricia Nunan

communications.subject: Your City of Los Angeles public records request #25-653 has been closed.
communications.communication:
City of Los Angeles ************************************************************************ Record request #25-653 has been closed. The closure reason supplied was: Dear Requestor,   We have reviewed your request for "any and all documents related to the murder of Dr. Haing Samnang Ngor."   Your request was made under the California Public Records Act (the Act). The Department is cognizant of its responsibilities under the Act. It recognizes the statutory scheme was enacted to maximize citizen access to the workings of government. The Act does not mandate disclosure of all documents within the government’s possession. Rather, by specific exemption and reference to other statutes, the Act recognizes that there are boundaries where the public’s right to access must be balanced against such weighty considerations as the right of privacy, a right of constitutional dimension under California Constitution, Article 1, Section 1. The law also exempts from disclosure records that are privileged or confidential or otherwise exempt under either express provisions of the Act or pursuant to applicable federal or state law, per California Government Code Sections 7927.200; 7927.700; 7923.600-7923.625; 7927.705; and 7922.000.   In accordance with Sections 7923.600-7923.625 of the California Government Code, records of investigations conducted by, or investigatory files compiled by, any local police agency for law enforcement purposes, are exempt from disclosure. Should any records be located, 9-1-1 telephone calls, recordings, transcripts, witness statements, logs, crime scene photographs, and video evidence are either investigatory records themselves or properly part of an investigative file and therefore exempt from disclosure. Therefore, we are denying your request. Records may be produced in response to a subpoena or court order with pending litigation.   If you have any questions, simply respond to this email.   Respectfully,   LAPD Public Records & Subpoena Response Section, CPRA Unit  ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at City of Los Angeles.

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request #25-653
communications.communication:
Dear Sir or Madam,

I am appealing your decision to reject my FOIA request for Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD) files related to the murder of Dr. Haing S. Ngor, on February 25, 1996.

The previous rejection of my FOIA request cites the California Government Code.

However, the LAPD has already made this material available to other media organizations, and therefore has no basis to deny them to my production of the investigatory podcast, “Who Killed Haing Ngor?”

Therefore, I am repeating my request for the following material, marked by *** below.

In “The Price of Duty,” Season One; Episode 3, the LAPD has participated in production, or shared evidence, in the following ways: 

-	This documentary revolves around an extended interview conducted with the full cooperation of Detective Sergeant John Garcia of the Los Angeles Police Department.

-	This documentary was conducted with the full cooperation of with Deputy District Attorney Craig Hum.

-	This documentary features a prominent interview with Detective Ed Yee, and a conversation between him and Detective Sergeant Garcia

The aforementioned conversations with Detective Sergeant Garcia and Detective Ed Yee’s and their revelation of and discussions about relevant content of the investigation could not have taken place without the consent of the LAPD.  

To Wit: 

AUDIO
Detective Sergeant Garcia and Deputy District Attorney Hum reference the contents of recordings of “prior statements” made by witnesses to police before the trial. 

*** I hereby request copies of the tape-recordings of “prior statements,” made by police, referenced by Hum and Garcia. 

The LAPD shared with documentary-makers crime scene photos, including images from inside of the victim's vehicle; images of spent shell casings; pages from the Coroner's report; and diagrams from the crime scene.

*** I hereby request copies of crime scene photos, including but not limited to those shared with documentary-makers, in preparation for their production. (This request includes those photographs shown to the producers of the documentary for selection of inclusion in their production, not limited to only those televised.) 

This is not the only instance in which investigative file contents were shared with the media. 

These photos were also shared with media in “The Killing Fields of Dr. Haing S. Ngor,” a documentary produced in 2015 by Arthur Dong, of Deep Focus Productions, Inc.

During this documentary, crime scene photographs were shared with the production team, 
including those depicting Ngor’s body at rest; and exteriors and interiors of Ngor’s apartment, and other photographs depicting evidence and police activities. 

*** I hereby request copies of all investigative file documents and photographs provided to producers for review for inclusion in their documentary.

I have reached out both production companies with regards to what documents and photographs they were provided access to in the making of their films. However, I have yet to hear back. 
 
INTERVIEW GRANTED TO MEDIA
In 2024, Detective Ed Yee gave an on the record interview to Los Angeles-based production company, Western Sound, for their “Strangeland – Killing Fields of LA” podcast on the Ngor murder. 

Among other investigative revelations Detective Ed Yee discussed, he also said, "I had friends that lived right next door to Haing Ngor or lived across the street from Haing Ngor" at the time of Ngor's murder. 

This information was corroborated to me by a third party, known to me.

*** Therefore, I request all notes and reports related to Detective Ed Yee’s interviewing of those people and whether they identified any of the three defendants as possible suspects; and any written disclosures by Yee of his relationship with any of the potential witnesses.

*** Based on Detective Yee’s candid revelation of his participation in this investigation during a podcast interview, I would like access to all of Detective Yee’s notes and reports. 

Given the above, the precedent has been set for sharing this material with media, and there is no reason to deny my request.


Due to the fact that these separate productions have intellectual property rights, and represent my competition, I cannot use any other media organization’s material in my production.
Therefore, I demand at least equal access to the same documents, files, recordings and reports that they had, up to and including interviews with Detective John Garcia, Deputy District Attorney Craig Hum, and Detective Ed Yee. 

Thank you for your cooperation. I think we would all rather avoid a First Amendment case on this matter, but I am open to pursuing every option legally available to me.

Best,



Mary Patricia Nunan

Thank you.

title: Berkeley Homeless Litigation Expenses and Transcripts

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Berkeley Homeless Litigation Expenses and Transcripts
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All transcripts, receipts, invoices, time sheets indicating any expenses, or staff time, that works on the following legal cases:

Berkeley Homeless Union v City of Berkeley 4:25-cv-04449-HSG

Berkeley Homeless Union v City of Berkeley 25-cv-01414-EMC

Prado v City of Berkeley, 4:23-04537-EMC

All transcripts received by the City of Berkeley from any Court Reporter in the case Berkeley Homeless Union v City of Berkeley 25-cv-01414-EMC

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robbie Powelson

title: NIH legal name documents

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: NIH legal name documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The March 21 memo informing NIH employees that they can only use “full legal name” in email signatures and cannot use pronouns or "nicknames". I also request any other agency memos, guidance documents or communications regarding this new policy or any other policy implemented in response to Executive Order 14168, known as "Defending Women from Gender Ideology Extremism and Restoring Biological Truth to the Federal Government."

I request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

title: Request for civil commitment data

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for civil commitment data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

For the most recent date available, I am requesting the number of people who are in civil detention or civil commitment in Florida. Specifically, I request the following data as of the most recent date available: 

1) the total number of people civilly committed in Florida by sex (typically people found "not guilty by reason of insanity" or "guilty but mentally ill); and, 
2) the number of people civilly detained in Florida by sex (typically people being evaluated or treated for incompetency to stand trial). 

If this data is not available by sex, I request the total numbers regardless of sex. 
If this data is held by another state agency, I request the name of that agency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Emily Widra

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days. 
Sincerely, 
Emily Widra

https://www.muckrock.com/respond/2210819/ 
Filed via MuckRock.com 
E-mail (Preferred): 204250-23919314@requests.muckrock.com 
PLEASE NOTE OUR NEW ADDRESS 
For mailed responses, please address (see note): 
MuckRock News 
DEPT MR 204250 
263 Huntington Ave 
Boston, MA 02115 
After a diligent search, the department has located records responsive to your request. You asked for records indicating the gender of the individuals detained by or committed to the Department pursuant to Chapter 394, Part. V. I have been advised that all individuals who currently meet that criteria are male. 
These records have been released to the Florida DCF Public Records Center.  Please log in to access the records. 
Thank you for your patience in awaiting this information. 
Sincerely, 

Office of General Counsel

title: Music available on JPay/Securus tablets

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Music available on JPay/Securus tablets
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. The catalog of music available to incarcerated people for purchase on the JPay/Securus music application. This includes but is not limited to: album art, song metadata, song titles, artists, pricing, and an mp3 or other listenable version of the song. I would also accept a link to access the catalog myself. 
2. Contracts between the WA DOC and the JPay music provider.
3. Contracts between WA DOC and JPay/Securus.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Yael Eiger

communications.communication:
Dear Yael Eiger: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of Washington Department of Corrections. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW. Your request was received in this office on 12/2/2025 and given the reference number P057633-120225 for tracking purposes. 
This message is an automated confirmation of your request, and does not constitute an official Department acknowledgement under RCW 42.56.520. Agency staff will provide a separate correspondence formally acknowledging this request within 5 business days. 
You can monitor the progress of your request in " My Request Center"

communications.subject: [Records Center] Public Records Request :: P057633-120225
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Yael Eiger: 

I acknowledge receipt of your public records request dated December 2, 2025, and received in our office on December 3, 2025. We have assigned this request a tracking number of P-57633.  Please refer to this number in all future communications regarding this request. 

I understand you are requesting the following records: 

1. A copy of the current, as of December 3, 2025, music catalog for the JPay/Securus tablets music application showing what music is available for incarcerated individuals to purchase. To also include: 
a. Album art 
b. Song metadata 
c. Artists 
d. Pricing 
e. Listenable version of each song 
2. A copy of the contracts between the Washington DOC and the JPay music provider 
3. A copy of the contracts between the Washington DOC and JPay/Securus 

If my interpretation is incorrect, please notify me through the request portal or email me at mrivera@doc1.wa.gov; otherwise, I will proceed accordingly. (mailto:mrivera@doc1.wa.gov) 

Items 2 and 3 of your request are available to the public on our website and can be found at the following link: Contracts | Washington State Department of Corrections. Hello, The City of Port Angeles has received your request and we look forward to assisting you. We will be responding from this email account (Records Request Center (Port Angeles, WA)) each time. Please add us to your safe sender list if this message originally went to your spam or junk folder. The City administers public records requests in strict compliance with RCW 42.56 and Chapter 2.74 - Inspection of Public Records . Our Public Records Policy is enforced as required by RCW 42.56.100. The City of Port Angeles received your request for public records on 9/8/2025 8:05:51 PM and will respond as soon as possible, providing one of the following:  
  *  We will provide the requested record(s), 
  *  We will provide a link to the specific records requested,

We have identified our search team and the records are now being collected.  Once the records are collected, we will review them prior to release.  Due to the number of records that were immediately gathered, we will need to process this request in installments. We expect to provide a first installment on or around September 26, 2025.  We estimate we will complete this request on or around October 31, 2025.  This estimate is based on the number of records requests we are responding to simultaneously to this one, while also attending to our daily tasks.  Should we need to extend this request, we will communicate that information to you along with a new delivery date.  We will do our very best to stay on schedule in order to provide you the fullest assistance possible so we may complete your request in a timely manner.  E:  Public Records Request # W020181-090825 Dear Jean Wolguelam: The City of Port Angeles received your request on 9/8/2025, for the following records: Other: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Sincerely, 

Jean Wolguelam

This estimate is based on the number of requests we are processing simultaneously in our system in addition to our other duties.  We will do our very best to stay on schedule in order to provide you the fullest assistance possible and complete your request in a timely manner. If you have any questions, please respond to this email. Sincerely, Kari Martinez-Bailey City Clerk

title: CO County CVR Request (2022, 2024) (Montrose County Clerk & Recorder's Office)

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: CO County CVR Request (2022, 2024) (Montrose County Clerk & Recorder's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Cast vote record (CVR) data for the following elections:
1. 2022 Nov Midterm Election
2. 2024 Nov General Election

Specifically, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast each election in Montrose County generated by the voting system.

In case it is helpful for your reference, you can find an example of these records in REDACTED format at this link on the Arapahoe County webpage: https://www.arapahoevotes.gov/transparency
If you follow the "Redacted Cast Vote Record (CVR)" link on that webpage, it will download a csv file with Arapahoe County's redacted CVR records (this: https://gis.arapahoegov.com/dl_data/cr_voter_data/redacted_cvr/REDACTED_CVR_Export_20241126111830_330948.zip.)

I am requesting these records NOT redacted pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act. Please let me know if you need any further clarification on the type of data that I am requesting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska

communications.subject: RE: Colorado Open Records Act Request: CO County CVR Request (2022, 2024) (Montrose County Clerk & Recorder's Office)
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,



This message is in response to your request below.



Please be aware that the CVR data for elections in Montrose County are 
publicly available on our website. For your convenience, here is a link to 
search the elections: https://electionstats.montrosecounty.net/eng/. After 
you search the year that you are requesting, a CSV file with the CVR data is 
accessible on the left side of the page, which contains all records 
responsive to your request.



Montrose County now considers this matter closed. If you believe Montrose 
County has not been responsive to your request, please let me know.



Sincerely,




Ryan J. Dunn

Assistant County Attorney

Montrose County

320 S. 1st St., Suite 400

Montrose, CO 81401

Office: 970-252-4514





Confidentiality Notice:   This e-mail is intended only for the person or 
entity to which it is addressed and may contain information that is 
privileged, confidential, or otherwise protected from disclosure. 
Dissemination, distribution, or copying of this e-mail or the information 
herein by anyone other than the intended recipient, or an employee or agent 
responsible for delivering the message to the intended recipient, is 
prohibited. If you have received this e-mail in error, please e-mail or call 
Ryan J. Dunn or Montrose County, and destroy the original message and all 
copies.





  _____

communications.subject: RE: Colorado Open Records Act Request: CO County CVR Request (2022, 2024) (Montrose County Clerk & Recorder's Office)
communications.communication:
Hi there,

Thank you very much for your prompt and helpful note! I apologize for not having been able to locate these records on your website myself initially. 

But I'm just following up now because unfortunately I still cannot locate the CVR data on your webpage. Really sorry about this - I've spent a lot of time at the link you provided looking for CVR data of any kind but have had no luck. I am attaching a screenshot of what the page returns when I search for just the 2024 General election.  In the screenshot you can see that under "Data Exports" only the precinct level returns are available to download across all formats (pdf, csv, html). These data provide just the vote totals by office and precinct. I don't see anything about CVR records anywhere, including under the advanced search. I have also attached the CSV file that is output when I click "Precinct Results" just for your reference in case it is helpful.

My sincerest apologies for the hassle with this. I am trying my hardest to locate the records myself on your website but I have just been unable to find what you describe in this email. I would be extremely remiss to create additional work for you but I am at a loss. I hope you understand, and thank you very much again for your time and patience. 

All my best,
Aleksandra Conevska

title: Mattie Parker, Alan Blaylock Tim O'Hare meeting correspondence

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Mattie Parker, Alan Blaylock Tim O'Hare meeting correspondence
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any email, text or phone correspondence between the following officials and their respective offices:
- Tarrant County Judge Timothy O'Hare  and Fort Worth City Councilmember Alan Blaylock
- O'Hare and Mayor Mattie Parker
- O'Hare and Rep. Nate Schatzline

between 10/1/2025-10/15/2025 regarding the meeting between O'Hare, Parker, Blaylock discussed by Rep. Nate Schatzline in this Oct 13 video published to Instagram:

https://www.instagram.com/p/DPwN06ejqyt/?hl=en

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

2. Full list of attendees present at the meeting between O'Hare, Parker, Blaylock, Schatzline, and faith leaders referenced by Rep. Schatzline.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bradford William Davis

communications.communication:
RE: Request Number Request Number: CDA-2025-2321 Submitted on: 11/04/2025 
  
 Dear Bradford William Davis, 
  
 For the County to continue to process your request for records, we require additional information. Please provide the following: 
  
 a. Please provide specific keywords or phrases to assist with locating the responsive records. 
  
 b. Please confirm if you are seeking records between Judge O’Hare and Fort Worth City Councilmember Alan Blaylock only, or the Councilmember’s staff as well. If you are seeking communications with his staff, please provide the name and/or email for everyone you consider to be part of his staff as our office would not have this information. 
  
 c. Please confirm if you are seeking records between Judge O’Hare and Mayor Mattie Parker only, or the mayor’s staff as well. If you are seeking communications with her staff, please provide the name and/or email for everyone you consider to be part of her staff as our office would not have this information.

If you are seeking communications with his staff, please provide the name and/or email for everyone you consider to be part of his staff as our office would not have this information. 
  
 Per Texas Government Code section 552.222, if a written response to this request for clarification or narrowing is not received within 61 days, your request is considered withdrawn.

communications.subject: Tarrant County District Attorney's Office - Records Request CDA-2025-2321 Clarification Requested
communications.communication:
RE: Request Number Request Number: CDA-2025-2321 Submitted on: 11/04/2025 
  
 Dear Bradford William Davis, 
  
 Thank you for clarifying your request. Our office is currently processing your request for records; however, please be aware that your request for correspondence including "all @fortworthtexas.gov" email domains is incredibly broad. This email domain is used by a wide variety of potentially non-responsive departments including the Fort Worth Police Department and the Fort Worth Water Department. Please confirm if you would like our office to continue the search "as-is," or if we can exclude correspondence from other departments. 
  
 Per Texas Government Code section 552.222, if a written response to this request for clarification or narrowing is not received within 61 days, your request is considered withdrawn.

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Smith County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Smith County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

title: Communications About Tobacco Bars in CT with Danbury, CT Health Department

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide copies of communications sent to or received from the Department of Public Health, either physical or electronic including those by or through the Commissioner as well as any staff at the Tobacco Control Program, now the Tobacco And Cannabis Prevention Program in regards to Tobacco Bars in Connecticut. This would also include those communications by Corporation Counsel.

I am always available to discuss in conference.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kevin Paige

communications.subject: RE: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Connecticut Freedom of Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Jan. 14, 2026. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: FOIA Request
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon:

This will acknowledge receipt of your Freedom of Information request,
received in this office on January 22, 2026.


Please be advised that the City of Danbury is firmly committed to providing
prompt access to all records subject to disclosure under Connecticut
General Statutes §1-210, et. seq.  Accordingly, all documents will be
assembled and reviewed as quickly as reasonably possible in light of other
responsibilities and immediate commitments.  Although the City of Danbury
takes your request seriously and will respond as promptly as possible, we
reserve the right to petition the Freedom of Information Commission for a
declaratory ruling regarding requests that may be exempt from disclosure.


Please note, that there will be a charge of $.50 per page, and any amount
of over $10.00 must be paid in advance.



If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me.


-- 
[image: photo]
*Tracy L. Norris*
Assistant Corporation Counsel
City of Danbury

( <(203)+797-4625+x7356>203)797-4518 ext. 7213 | t.norris@danbury-ct.gov

(203)796-8043 Fax

155 Deer Hill Avenue, Danbury, CT 06810

title: Clinton County (IL) Dairy Subsidies - EXPEDITED REQUEST

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Clinton County (IL) Dairy Subsidies - EXPEDITED REQUEST
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear FOIA Officer,

Please consider this a request under the the Federal Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552.

Under the Act, I am requesting the 2024, 2023, 2022, 2021 and 2020 applications to receive subsidies under the programs: Dairy Margin Coverage (DMC), Milk Loss Program (MLP), Dairy Indemnity Payment Program (DIPP) for the following producers:
* Varel Dairy; Bartelso, Illinois.
* Thole AG; Aviston, Illinois.
* JB Timmermann Farms; Breese, Illinois.
* Four Beck Dairy; Bartleso, Illinois.
* C D & R Farms, Inc.; Breese, Illinois.
* Dall Dairy; Aviston, Illinois
* Glen Von Bokel Farms; Carlyle, Illinois
* Aaron Hilmes; Carlyle, Illinois
* Corey Hilmes; Breese, Illinois
* Arentsen Farms; Albers, Illinois

In order to help to determine my status to assess fees, you should know that I am reporter with Capitol News Illinois, and this request is made as part of news gathering and not for a commercial use. I request a waiver of all fees for this request. Disclosure of the requested information to me is in the public interest because it is likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government and is not primarily in my commercial interest by exploring the federal supports to local dairy farmers. 

I hereby request expedited processing of this request pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E) because there is an urgency to inform the public concerning actual or alleged Federal Government activity, and I am a person primarily engaged in disseminating information,

Thank you for your consideration of this request.

Sincerely,

 

Name
Address
City, State, Zip Code
Telephone number [Optional]

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Beth Hundsdorfer

communications.subject: Request 2026-FSA-02533-F - Hundsdorfer - Acknowledgement / Clarification / Expedited Processing
communications.communication:
Ms. Hundsdorfer,
This letter acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request (copy attached) dated January 26, 2026, to the Department of Agriculture (USDA) Farm Production and Conservation Business Center (FPAC-BC). Your request was received in this office January 28, 2026, and assigned control number 2026-FSA-02533-F. Please use this control number for all future communications regarding this request.
​
We are unable to begin processing your request at this time because we cannot determine precisely which records you are seeking.  In your request form, you state that you are requesting
​
"the 2024, 2023, 2022, 2021 and 2020 applications to receive subsidies under the programs: Dairy Margin Coverage (DMC), Milk Loss Program (MLP), Dairy Indemnity Payment Program (DIPP) for the following producers: * Varel Dairy; Bartelso, Illinois. * Thole AG; Aviston, Illinois. * JB Timmermann Farms; Breese, Illinois.* Four Beck Dairy; Bartleso, Illinois. * C D & R Farms, Inc.; Breese, Illinois.* Dall Dairy; Aviston, Illinois * Glen Von Bokel Farms; Carlyle, Illinois * Aaron Hilmes; Carlyle, Illinois * Corey Hilmes; Breese, Illinois * Arentsen Farms; Albers, Illinois”
​
However, we need to confirm whether you have written consent from the producer(s)/entity(ies) listed above to receive unredacted copies of their DMC, MLP and DIPP applications?  If yes, please provide a copy of the consent by replying to this email.  If not, are you willing to receive redacted versions of these documents instead?

We cannot proceed further with your request until we receive additional written clarification from you.  Please note that if we do not hear from you within 20 business days from the date of this email, we will assume that you are no longer interested in pursuing your request and we will administratively close your request.

In your letter, you requested a fee waiver. You were placed in the “Media Use” requester category, as such all fees are waived.

In your letter, you also requested expedited processing of your request. According to USDA regulations at Title 7, CFR 1.9(b), it is the policy of FSA to grant a request for expedited processing whenever the requester demonstrates that the request involves:


  1.  Circumstances in which the lack of expedited processing could reasonably be expected to pose an imminent threat to the life or physical safety of an individual or


  1.  An urgency to inform the public about an actual or alleged Federal Government activity, if made by an individual primarily engaged in disseminating information

You state that you are requesting expedited processing of your request, because there is an urgency to inform the public concerning actual or alleged Federal Government activity, however, your letter did not provide an adequate justification to support your argument.  Therefore, we are processing your request on a “first in, first out” basis in the complex track.

If you believe the determination to deny your request for expedited processing is incorrect, you may appeal to the FSA Administrator.  The Appeals and Litigation Staff must receive your written appeal within ninety (90) calendar days of the date of this letter.  Please include in the appeal a brief explanation of why you believe this decision is in error.  Be sure to include a copy of your initial request letter in your appeal package.  You may submit your appeal electronically to FSAFOIAappeal@wdc.usda.gov<mailto:FSAFOIAappeal@wdc.usda.gov> or by mail.  If mailing the appeal, clearly mark both your letter and its envelope with the words “Freedom of Information Act Appeal.”  Mail your appeal package to the following address:

FARM PRODUCTION AND CONSERVATION BUSINESS CENTER
ATTN:  APPEALS AND LITIGATION STAFF
1400 INDEPENDENCE AVE SW RM 5971-S
WASHINGTON DC 20250-0570
PHONE: (202) 690-3297
EMAIL: fsafoiaappeal@usda.gov<mailto:fsafoiaappeal@usda.gov>

You may seek dispute resolution services from the FSA FOIA liaison.  Contact information for the FSA FOIA liaison is:

FPAC – BC PUBLIC AFFAIRS LIAISON
EMAIL: SM.FP.FOIA@USDA.GOV<mailto:SM.FP.FOIA@USDA.GOV>

You may contact the Office of Government Information Services at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIA mediation services they offer.  Contact information for the Office of Government Services is:

OFFICE OF GOVERNMENT INFORMATION SERVICES
NATIONAL ARCHIVES AND RECORDS ADMINISTRATION
8601 ADELPHI ROAD-OGIS
COLLEGE PARK, MARYLAND 20740-6001
PHONE: (202) 741-5770
TOLL FREE: (877) 684-6448
FAX: (202) 741-5769
EMAIL:  ogis@nara.gov<mailto:ogis@nara.gov>

Contacting the FSA FOIA liaison or the Office of Government Information Services does not affect your right to administratively appeal to FSA.

If you have any questions regarding the processing of this request, please contact Government Information (GI) Specialist Christina Vander Linden at 816-823-2669.  If GI Specialist Christina Vander Linden at 816-823-2669 is not available, please contact GI Specialist Hani Nguyen at 651-602-7848 or GI Specialist Carol Nagel at 701-530-2107.  We can also be reached at the group e-mail address SM.FP.FOIA@usda.gov<mailto:SM.FP.FOIA@usda.gov>.

Sincerely,

Patrick McLoughlin
Patrick McLoughlin
FOIA OFFICER

communications.communication:
Ms. Hundsdorfer,

Per your email below, you have agreed to accept redacted copies for the 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, and 2024 applications to receive subsidies under the programs: Dairy Margin Coverage (DMC), Milk Loss Program (MLP), Dairy Indemnity Payment Program (DIPP) for the following producers: * Varel Dairy; Bartelso, Illinois. * Thole AG; Aviston, Illinois. * JB Timmermann Farms; Breese, Illinois.* Four Beck Dairy; Bartleso, Illinois. * C D & R Farms, Inc.; Breese, Illinois.* Dall Dairy; Aviston, Illinois * Glen Von Bokel Farms; Carlyle, Illinois * Aaron Hilmes; Carlyle, Illinois * Corey Hilmes; Breese, Illinois * Arentsen Farms; Albers, Illinois”
​
Your request is being handled under the provisions of the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. § 552 (http://www.usdoj.gov/oip/amended-foia-redlined.pdf).

We process requests on a first-in, first-out basis.  The actual processing time will depend upon the complexity of the request and whether or not it involves sensitive or voluminous records, or extensive searches and/or consultations.  We also process requests on a multi-track basis.  This means that simple requests, requiring minimal effort to respond, are processed in one track, and more voluminous and complex requests are processed in another track.  We have placed your request in the Simple track.

Request 2026-FSA-02533-F is perfected and has been moved from pending into the Simple processing track.  This request has been placed in the “Media Use” Request Category and all fees will be waived.

The estimated date upon which we expect to provide you the requested records is on or before: Feb 26, 2026.

If you have questions concerning this request, please contact Government Information (GI) Specialist Christina Vander Linden at 816-823-2669. If GI Specialist Christina Vander Linden is not available, please contact GI Specialist Carol Nagel at 701-530-2107 or GI Specialist Hani Nguyen at 651-602-7848. We can also be reached at the group e-mail address SM.FP.FOIA@usda.gov<mailto:SM.FP.FOIA@usda.gov>.

I appreciate the opportunity to assist you in this matter.

Sincerely,

Patrick McLoughlin

communications.subject: Request 2026-FSA-02533-F - Hundsdorfer - Final Response
communications.communication:
Ms. Hundsdorfer,

This responds to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request dated January 26, 2026, which was received in this office on January 28, 2026, and assigned control number 2026-FSA-02533-F.

In response to your request, we located the Dairy Margin Coverage (DMC) documents for Varel Dairy, Thole AG, JB Timermann Farms, Four Beck Dairy, C D & R Farms, Dall Dairy, Aaron Hilmes and Corey Hilmes, comprising of 80 pages.  With respect to these pages, we are releasing 8 pages in full,  72 pages redacted in part, and zero (0) pages withheld in full, pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(b)(3) and (b)(6) of the FOIA.

Electronic copies have been sent as attachments to this email.

With respect to the portion of your request for DMC, Milk Loss Program (MLP), and Dairy Indemnity Payment Program (DIPP) documents for Glen Von Bokel Farms and Arentsen Farms, a comprehensive search was conducted for the records you seek, however no responsive records were found.

With respect to the portion of your request for MLP documents for Varel Dairy,  Thole AG, JB Timmermann Farms, Four Beck Dairy, C D & R Farms, Inc, Dall Dairy, Aaron Hilmes, and Corey Hilmes, a comprehensive search was conducted for the records you seek, however no responsive records were found.

With respect to the portion of your request for DIPP documents for Varel Dairy, Thole AG, JB Timmermann Farms, Four Beck Dairy, C D & R Farms,  Dall Dairy, Aaron Hilmes and Corey Hilmes, a comprehensive search was conducted for the records you seek, however no responsive records were found.

With respect to the portion of your request for 2020 DMC documents for Varel Dairy, Thole AG, JB Timmermann Farms, Four Beck Dairy, and Corey Hilmes, a comprehensive search was conducted for the records you seek, however no responsive records were found.

Exemption 3 -- 5 U.S.C. § 552(b)(3): protects information included in FSA's records specifically exempted from disclosure by another Federal Statute.

Pursuant to exemption 3, 72 pages have been withheld in part.

In this instance Section 1619(b) of the Food, Conservation and Energy Act of 2008 (7 USC § 8791), prohibits disclosing the information requested.

The records you have requested include information that FSA has obtained from agricultural producers or landowners that concerns their farming or agricultural operation, including production and marketing of agricultural commodities and livestock, farming practices, conservation practices or the land itself.  The type of information withheld includes producer address, dairy operation number, share percentage, production history, coverage level, phone number and email address. This information is required to be provided to FSA for the agricultural producers and/or landowners shown on these records to participate in FSA's farm programs.

Exemption 6 -- 5 U.S.C. § 552(b)(6): Exemption 6 protects personal information affecting an individual's privacy.

Pursuant to exemption 6, 72 pages have been withheld in part.

Specifically, exemption 6 protects personnel and medical files and similar files, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy. The courts have held that the phrase "similar files" involves all information that applies to a particular person. When disclosure of information about particular individuals is requested, the courts have decided that it is necessary for us to determine whether release of the information would constitute a clearly "unwarranted" invasion of the individuals' privacy. To make this determination, we are required to perform a "balancing test." This means that we must weigh the individual's right to privacy against the public's right to disclosure. In this instance, we have determined that the disclosure of this information would shed little or no light on the performance of the agency's statutory duties and that, on balance; the public interest to be served by its disclosure does not outweigh the privacy interest of the individuals in question, in withholding it. The records withheld under this exemption are producer address, dairy operation number, share percentage, production history, coverage level, phone number and email address.

If you believe our decision to withhold this information is incorrect, you may appeal to the FSA Administrator. The Appeals and Litigation Division must receive your written appeal within ninety (90) calendar days of the date of this letter.  Please include in the appeal a brief explanation of why you believe this decision is in error.  Be sure to include a copy of your initial request letter in your appeal package.  You may submit your appeal electronically to FSAFOIAappeal@wdc.usda.gov<mailto:FSAFOIAappeal@wdc.usda.gov>  or by mail.  If mailing the appeal, clearly mark both your letter and its envelope with the words "Freedom of Information Act Appeal."  Mail your appeal package to the following address:

FARM PRODUCTION AND CONSERVATION BUSINESS CENTER
ATTENTION: APPEALS AND LITIGATION DIVISION
1400 INDEPENDENCE AVENUE SW. ROOM 3243-S
MAIL STOP - 0570
WASHINGTON, D.C. 20250-0570
PHONE: (202) 690-3297
EMAIL: fsafoiaappeal@usda.gov<mailto:fsafoiaappeal@usda.gov>

You may seek dispute resolution services from the FOIA liaison.  Contact information for the FOIA liaison is:

FPAC - BC PUBLIC AFFAIRS LIAISON
EMAIL: SM.FP.FOIA@USDA.GOV<mailto:SM.FP.FOIA@USDA.GOV>

You may contact the Office of Government Information Services at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIA mediation services they offer.  Contact information for the Office of Government Information Services is:

OFFICE OF GOVERNMENT INFORMATION SERVICES
NATIONAL ARCHIVES AND RECORDS ADMINISTRATION
8601 ADELPHI ROAD-OGIS
COLLEGE PARK, MARYLAND 20740-6001

Contacting the FOIA liaison or the Office of Government Information Services does not affect your right to administratively appeal to FSA Administrator.

Request 2026-FSA-02533-F is officially closed.

If you have questions concerning this request, please contact Government Information (GI) Specialist Christina Vander Linden at 816-823-2669. If GI Specialist Christina Vander Linden is not available, please contact GI Specialist Carol Nagel at 701-530-2107 or GI Specialist Hani Nguyen at 651-602-7848. We can also be reached at the group e-mail address SM.FP.FOIA@usda.gov<mailto:SM.FP.FOIA@usda.gov>.

Sincerely,

Patrick McLoughlin

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Roxanne Argudin Witness Statements Hate Crime Cases (Fredericksburg Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any reports, memoranda, emails, or documentation regarding witness Roxanne Argudin's:
- Credibility concerns
- Conflicting statements
- Failure to appear
- Cooperation issues
- Statement inconsistencies

For cases from October 2024 through present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Hamilton Jones.

title: Third-Party FOIA Request – Complete A-File – Emory University F-1, J-1, and M-1 nonimmigrant students (SEVIS-tracked) Student (Anonymous Requester)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Third-Party FOIA Request – Complete A-File – Emory University F-1, J-1, and M-1 nonimmigrant students (SEVIS-tracked) Student (Anonymous Requester)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear USCIS FOIA Officer,
MuckRock submits this third-party FOIA request on behalf of an anonymous requester who is the subject of the records.
The requester is the subject of the records and invokes both FOIA and the Privacy Act of 1974 (5 U.S.C. § 552a) for full release without redactions beyond statutory minima. The requester seeks the complete A-file and all USCIS records concerning an Emory University F-1, J-1, and M-1 nonimmigrant students (SEVIS-tracked) student whose SEVIS record was terminated without notice between 2015 and the present. The requester’s identity and A-number are withheld to protect privacy and safety, but the requester is the subject of the records and expressly consents to disclosure to the filing organization for immediate forwarding to the requester.
Requested records:
1.	The complete Alien File (A-file), including all electronic records. 
2.	All Forms I-20, reinstatement applications (I-539), OPT/CPT approvals or denials, and related correspondence. 
3.	All internal USCIS communications with Emory University, its DSOs, SEVP, or ICE regarding the requester’s SEVIS-tracked nonimmigrant status or SEVIS termination. 
4.	Any administrative record of a reinstatement decision and any entries reflecting accrual of unlawful presence.
Time period: January 01, 2015 – December 18, 2025.
Fee waiver is requested under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii) in light of due-process deprivations akin to Zadvydas v. Davis, 533 U.S. 678 (2001), and Mathews v. Eldridge, 424 U.S. 319 (1976). Expedited processing is requested under 6 C.F.R. § 5.5(e)(1)(iv) due to ongoing litigation urgency and irreparable harm (Kuck Baxter v. DHS, N.D. Ga. 2025; Liu v. Noem, D.N.H. 2025).
All records received must be forwarded to the anonymous requester in full within five (5) business days of receipt, without additional redactions.
Thank you.
Respectfully submitted,
MuckRock News on behalf of Anonymous Requester

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

neutralrequest47

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #COW2026000046
communications.communication:
Dear Acting Chief Panter:
Re: FOIA Control No. COW2026000046 / 2026-HQFO-01205
Thank you for your response.
Further, to previous correspondence, in order to facilitate processing consistent with 5 U.S.C. § 552 and 6 C.F.R. Part 5. 
To streamline processing:
I. Withdrawal (Without Prejudice) of Personal A-File Portion
The portion of the request seeking a complete A-file and personal USCIS records is hereby withdrawn without prejudice.
In due course, a separate FOIA/Privacy Act request will be submitted with appropriate verification under 6 C.F.R. § 5.21(e).
II. Clarified FOIA Request (Non-Privacy Records)
These records are not requested by reference to any individual’s name, A-number, or other personal identifier, and therefore do not constitute a Privacy Act “system of records” request under 5 U.S.C. § 552a.
The original request (attached for reference) sufficiently describes the records with reasonable detail, specifically:
1.	SEVP audit reports, compliance reviews, or certification actions concerning Emory University (2015–2025).
2.	Corrective action notices, warning letters, sanctions, or compliance correspondence between DHS/SEVP/ICE and Emory University.
3.	Internal DHS memoranda, directives, or implementation guidance concerning SEVIS termination procedures affecting SEVP-certified institutions.
4.	Litigation-related memoranda or public filings concerning Kuck Baxter v. DHS, to the extent maintained by DHS as agency records.
These are agency records subject to FOIA and do not involve personal identity verification requirements.
________________________________________
III. Particularity and Search Terms
To assist your office:
Relevant Entities
•	“Emory University”
•	“Emory University ISSS”
•	“Emory University School of Law”
•	“Emory School of Law”
•	“Office of the President” 
•	“Office of General Counsel” or “OGC” 
•	“International Student and Scholar Services” or “ISSS” 
•	“Office of Bar Admissions” or “OBA”
•	“State Bar of Georgia”
•	“Supreme Court of Georgia”
•	“Office of the President” 
•	“Office of General Counsel” or “OGC” 
•	“International Student and Scholar Services” or “ISSS” 
•	“Office of Bar Admissions” or “OBA”
•	“State Bar of Georgia”
•	“Supreme Court of Georgia”
•	“U.S. Department of Homeland Security” or “DHS”
•	“Student and Exchange Visitor Program” or “SEVP”
•	“U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement” or “ICE”
•	“U.S. Department of Education” or “ED”
•	“Office for Civil Rights” or “OCR”
•	“SEVP”
•	“ICE”
•	“HSI”
•	“SEVIS”
•	“I-20”
•	“F-1 visa”
•	“J-1 visa”
•	“nonimmigrant student”
•	“undocumented student”
•	“bar eligibility”
•	“immigration status”
Suggested Search Terms
•	“Emory SEVIS audit”
•	“Emory compliance review”
•	“Emory corrective action”
•	“SEVIS termination policy”
•	“I-20 termination guidance”
•	“Emory sponsor certification”
•	“Kuck Baxter”
Date Range
January 1, 2015 – December 18, 2025.
This request expressly excludes any records retrievable by personal identifier and is limited to institutional, policy, compliance, and oversight records maintained by DHS components.
________________________________________
IV. Fee Waiver
To the extent any responsive records contain limited personal identifiers, the agency should redact such information under 5 U.S.C. § 552(b)(6) or (b)(7)(C) and release reasonably segregable portions pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(b).
A fee waiver remains requested under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii) because:
•	The request concerns federal oversight of SEVP-certified institutions.
•	Disclosure would contribute significantly to public understanding of immigration enforcement practices.
•	The requester has no commercial interest.
V. Expedited Processing
Expedited processing is requested under 6 C.F.R. § 5.5(e)(1)(iv) because the request concerns government activity affecting nonimmigrant students and ongoing litigation of national scope.
VI. Appeal Rights
If this correspondence is treated as a denial or closure, this letter constitutes notice of administrative appeal under 6 C.F.R. § 5.8, and the agency is requested to preserve all appeal rights.
Sincerely,
neutralrequest47

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #COW2026000046
communications.communication:
Good morning,

Thank you for your email regarding USCIS FOIA Control Number COW2026000046.

The request in question has been officially closed and cannot be modified. If you wish to obtain the requested records, using the new perimeters, you must submit a new FOIA request through the USCIS FIRST Portal.

We must also advise, when submitting any new FOIA requests, you must provide your full legal name and not an anonymous identifier or alias.

We hope this information helps.

V/r,

Government Information Specialist
FOIA, Significant Interest Group
National Records Center/IRIS/USCIS
foiasig.nrc@uscis.dhs.gov<mailto:foiasig.nrc@uscis.dhs.gov>



WARNING: This document is FOR OFFICIAL USE ONLY (FOUO). It contains information that may be exempt from public release under the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. 552). This document is to be controlled, handled, transmitted, distributed, and disposed of in accordance with DHS policy relating to Sensitive But Unclassified (SBU) information and is not to be released to the public or other personnel who do not have a valid "need-to-know" without prior approval from the originator.
